title: Krux - Feelin' It
description:
Review and Details From Skate-The-Planet.com:

Feelin‘ It opens with some mad ramp construction going on. Check out the box cover and you'll see the mini mega-ramp they construct to leap over an inflatable pool full of inflatable swans and a few Krux team members (not inflated). Strange there were no inflatable girls - they'd seem to go hand-in-hand. Anyway...

Prior to skating across Croatia, Barcelona, Moscow and Shanghai we are treated to the final product of skate photog, Sponge-E filming the ultimate cover shot of Cairo Foster doing a handstand hand rail grind and landing it on his feet. If you caught Strange Notes: Covers, Baby, then you know how they did it. If you missed that behind the scenes glimpse, just revel in the fantasy that Cairo actually pulled it off. Even as a stunt he did an awesome job on that shoot!

Interspersed with the individual rider parts was the obligatory team montage. I found it far less annoying than most montages of this sort - enjoyed it actually and you will too. Complete with a slew of guest skaters along with the Krux team, you get a lot of different types of riders.

Bonus Stuff
Commercials: Wood Engineers, Cairo & Sponge-E, Krux Cannon, Cairo's Dream, English Duo, Icy Lou and Colt Spice
Krux in Croatia
Globe Trottin'
Shanghai Road Trip
Feelin‘ It

title: DC - The DC Video (Deluxe Edition)
description: This DVD contains the full "The DC Video" as well as bonus features which are the subject of this page. Search "The DC Video" for soundtrack info on the actual video. Two versions of "The Deluxe Edition" were released; one with a 16 page photo booklet, a blurb from Greg Hunt about filmmaking, a Q&A with Big Black, and a history of the mega ramp as told by Danny way; the other is a hardbound version with 82 pages of the aforementioned content as well as more photos and interviews with skaters appearing in the video.

title: Adored Skateboards - SPITTING IMAGE
description:
A skateboard video filmed, and edited by The Brunner Twins. Spitting Image is about two brothers looking for a big score and not waiting around for others. They are ready to go!
Adored Skateboards is very proud to have these two along for the ride. 
You are about to enter their world! Heists, destroying "The Mo", and doing what best friends do!
Dedicated to Brothers everywhere.

Happy Birthday Chris and Pierce. You are Adored!

title: Girl - Goldfish
description: Shortly after the formation of Girl Skateboards their first film, Goldfish, was released. The film features the original Girl team along with guest appearances from the Chocolate team. The film set the standard for all Girl films to follow by including creative and narrative skits starring team riders. The film was directed by Spike Jonze.

title: Action East - Underground: Along The Eastern Edge
description:
Action East Video Presents:
Forty five minutes of action packed street, freestyle, and ramp action showcasing The Up & Comers and some of the best locals who thrash to bio proportions.  All edited to some of the wildest music around!
Featuring Mike Vallely, 1st Place NSA Oceanside Streetstyler "The Hot Shoe Glue Foot" you've seen in the mags.  Ramp skaters like Jeff Jones, Steve Herring, the Barn Ramp's infamous "barn boys" Dennis & Jim Kanes, Papo Capiello, and soon to be known Darren Menditto.  Freestylists like Joe Humeres and Mike Kinney.  Street skaters like Soho's colorful Ian Frahm, Pepe Torres, & Harry Jumonji.  Plus J.T. Murphy, Rod Smith, Jeremy Henderson, and Mike Daher just to name a few.
You've seen their names in the contest results.  Now you can see them on video!

- Street Stylin'
- Doing It At The Blue
- Jammin' At The Brooklyn Banks
- Saturday Night Live At The Barn
- Glue Foot

description: The Element team delivers an audiovisual experience of global proportions, covering the continents in four exciting chapters. Gabriel, Vitoria, Donny, Funa, Jaakko, Nick and their accomplices don’t disappoint.

title: Deep Dish - Seven
description: 'On Nov 1st 2012, we released the first DEEP DISH edit and zine. Exactly 7 years later, we premiered our seventh full-length video. Looking back, it's crazy to me how much DEEP DISH has grown and yet how little it has changed. It started as a creative outlet — a way to keep my sanity and to document those I care most about. Today, it is the same. “seven” is the latest addition to our archive. “seven” was filmed over nearly two years, mostly in Chicago and partially on the East Coast where I moved for work. Big ups to Jon Schmoldt. Jon held it down in Chicago and was the main driving force behind documenting the crew while he also battled knee injuries. This video would not be possible without him and everyone featured in it. They all deserve a moment of recognition. A main motivation behind DEEP DISH has remained shining a light on the growing scene of Chicago. I often feel like a broken record preaching about the city & how it seems to be the forgotten city in skateboarding despite its abundant marble plazas and cutty gems. For those of you there, keep taking advantage of it. For those of you that haven't caught on, enjoy the video.'
